content.title: Chief Minister's Adarsh Gram Yoiana 2017
content.details: The Objective of the scheme is to develop 60 Model Villages in Arunachal Pradesh, which are equipped with all basic amenities such as 24x7 Piped Drinking water, Electricity at household level, primary school, primary health infrastructure, internal roads, avenues of employment generation and are open defecation free.
benefits: Piped Water Supply to all households within the village.
Providing electricity for all households/ Solar lights.
Construction of Pucca Houses for BPL Family (Not already a PMAY/IAY Beneficiary).
IHHLs/ Community Toilets (To be dovetailed with Swachh Bharat mission(rural)).
Providing Drainage facility within the village.
eligibility: The District Committee will identify and select beneficiary village.
The Deputy Commissioner will head the District Committee.
A dedicated Current account will be operated by the Deputy Commissioner.
content.application_process: Offline. Please contact to the Gram Panchayat office as well as Block Development Office.

faqs.question: When did the Mukhyamantri Adarsh Gram Panchayat Yojana start?
faqs.answer: According to the information, the Chief Minister had started the Mukhyamantri Adarsh Gram Panchayat Yojana in the year 2016 in the state.

faqs.question: What are the major components included in Adarsh Gram Yojana?
faqs.answer: Which are equipped with all basic amenities such as 24x7 Piped Drinking water, Electricity at household level, primary school, primary health infrastructure, internal roads, avenues of employment generation and are open defecation free.

faqs.question: How many villages are expected to benefit from Adarsh Gram Yojana?
How many outlay has sanctioned per village?
faqs.answer: A total outlay of Rs 1.5 Crores per village has been provided.

faqs.question: Who are the nodal implementing Agency?
faqs.answer: Block Development Office will be the nodal implementing Agency.

faqs.question: What kind of encouragement in this scheme?
faqs.answer: The program is not meant to be contractor driven but encouragement generation of local employment.

faqs.question: Is there any PROJECT COMPLETION REPORT required?
faqs.answer: Yes, On completion of every project, a Project Completion Report (PCR) should be prepared.
